p.s: A compilation of brief news reports for

s.hi: If you believe any of these stories deserves more in-depth coverage , feel free to write a full article on the issues raised .

head.s: Medicins Sans Frontieres announces partial withdrawal over Libyan torture abuses

p.s:
( MSF ) have announced a partial withdrawal from
Libya
.
The medical charity announced they will no longer work at Libyan detention centres due to facing treating torture victims in order to make them well enough to be further tortured .
MSF General Director Christopher Stokes said : " Our role is to provide medical care to war casualties and sick detainees , not to repeatedly treat the same patients between torture sessions " .

The United Nations estimates that some 8,500 former
Gaddafi
loyalists are being held by a number of unregulated , and unaccountable , armed groups .

item.s:
"
Libya : UN alarmed over failure to stop torture of detainees
" —
The Telegraph
, January 26 , 2012

"
Libyan detainees die after torture , says Amnesty International
" —
BBC News Online
, January 26 , 2012

head.s:
Jagger tells World Economic Forum ,
" ca n't always get what you want "

p.s:
Lead singer of
The Rolling Stones
Mick Jagger
has withdrawn from the ' Great British Tea Party ' in Davos ,
Switzerland
.

Cutting short his visit to the 2012
World Economic Forum
, as well as pulling out of Prime Minister
David Cameron
' s event intended to promote
UK
creativity , Jagger complained of both " being used as a political football " and " comment[s ] about my political allegiances which are inaccurate .

item.s:
"
Mick Jagger pulls out of David Cameron event amid ' political football ' claims
" —
The Telegraph
, January 25 , 2012

"
Jagger boycotts political football in Davos
" —
Russia Today
, January 25 , 2012

head.s: UK Prime Minister calls for European Union to be more competetive

p.s:
Speaking at the
World Economic Forum
in Davos , the
UK
Prime Minister
David Cameron
called on European Union leaders to be " bold " and " decisive " to boost growth and promote business .

Labelling a proposed financial transactions tax as " madness " he attacked " unnecessary " regulations on business , telling attendees that " Europe 's lack of competitiveness remains its Achilles heel .

item.s:
"
Davos : David Cameron urges Eurozone to take ' bold and decisive action '
" —
The Guardian
, January 26 , 2012

"
Be bold to promote business , Cameron tells Europe
" —
The Independent
, January 26 , 2012

head.s: Coup in Papua New Guinea fails

p.s:
A military coup in
Papua New Guinea
failed with the capture of at least fifteen mutineers .

These supporters of deposed former Prime Minister
Sir Michael Thomas Somare
seized a military barracks , and the nation 's military head , early on Thursday morning and demanded Somare be reinstated .

The Supreme Court of Papua New Guinea previously ruled that Somare be reinstated , concluding that current Prime Minister
Peter O'Neill
was unlawfully appointed .

item.s:
"
Papua New Guinea PM Says Military Mutiny is Over
" —
Voice of America
, January 26 , 2012

"
Papua New Guinea military coup fails
" —
The Guardian
, January 26 , 2012

head.s: Australian Prime Minister rescued from protesters

p.s:
During an Australia Day function , the country 's Prime Minister ,
Julia Gillard
— and the leader of the opposition ,
Tony Abbott
, had to be rescued after they were surrounded by as many as 200 aboriginal rights protesters at a Canberra restaurant .

The protesters , from the
Aboriginal Tent Embassy
, appear to have been angered by Abbot 's suggestion that it was time for the Embassy , now in its fortieth year , to come down .

item.s:
"
Julia Gillard ' rescued ' amid Australia Day protests
" —
BBC News Online
, January 26 , 2012

"
Australian PM stumbles before angry protesters
" —
CBS News
, January 26 , 2012
